project.teaser: The HeriTACE project brings together a transdisciplinary team of research institutes, authorities, SMEs, and industry experienced in design, technology, and policymaking in the domains of conservation, buildings and energy. A significant increase in deep renovations of...
project.objective: The HeriTACE project brings together a transdisciplinary team of research institutes, authorities, SMEs, and industry experienced in design, technology, and policymaking in the domains of conservation, buildings and energy. A significant increase in deep renovations of heritage buildings has the potential to lead to effective energy demand reductions and readiness for the transition to R2ES. Based on prior research and field knowledge supported by various EU and national projects, bottlenecks have been identified that prevent the futureproofing of heritage buildings and its replication. To overcome them, HeriTACE proposes innovative technical solutions, integrated into a holistic and multi-scale renovation approach, by developing and validating: (1) A replicable holistic assessment model and standardised processes to create a holistic vision and plan on the renovation requirements for heritage townhouses in historical neighbourhoods, (2) Optimal and integrated design approaches for the deep renovation of heritage townhouses, with well-considered, targeted and minimal invasive renovation measures, (3) Durable insulation and air tightness solutions for the renovation of building envelopes, respecting their heritage values and traditional building technology, (4) Optimised and smart controlled HVAC-concepts adapted to heritage townhouses, optimising comfort, and indoor air quality precisely where and when the building users need it, and (5) Integrated R²ES-based energy supply solutions, maximising the share of local R²ES in heritage buildings within historical neighbourhoods. The project will deliver solutions for authorities and designers to envision and govern a sustainable energy future for heritage townhouses in historical neighbourhoods, thus putting the EU Green Deal and New European Bauhaus into practice. Close collaboration between researchers, SMEs and industry shall increase the availability of high-quality solutions for the building conservation sector.
project.title: Future-proofing Heritage Buildings by Optimising Comfort and Energy in Time and Space
project.keywords: heritage buildings, renewable energy sources, HVAC, MPC, insulation systems

article.title: Holistic deep renovation approaches for climate-neutral historical neighbourhoods

result.title: Baseline scenarios
result.description: Definition and characteristics of the Pre-renovation and renovation baseline scenarios for the heritage townhouse archetypes with different cultural heritage values and heritage restrictions - as boundary conditions for WP2-3-4 concepts (Task 5.2)

result.title: HeriTACE Visual Identity
result.description: HeriTACE visual identity, including logo and other visual elements (incl. standard presentation and deliverable template), guidelines on the use of the visual identity assuring a common usage (Task 7.2)

result.title: Project Management Plan
result.description: To ensure project execution of the highest quality, a variety of standardised procedures, templates and instructions related to the management will be established and documented in the Project Management Handbook. (Task 1.1)

result.title: Map of KPI
result.description: Definition of qualitative and quantitative KPI, the metrics and assessment methods to be used to estimate the KPI throughout the project (Task 5.2)

result.title: Communication and Dissemination plan (version 2)
result.description: Integrated Plan for and communication and dissemination that will determine actions and define responsibilities and timelines to communicate and disseminate widely the results of the work carried out (Task 7.1, update)

result.title: Energy Conservation measures inventory
result.description: This report contains a longlist and shortlist of conservation-compatible energy conservation measures (i.e. insulation and air tightness measures) for the building envelope of heritage townhouses. The shortlist of measures is compiled from the longlist after a case-specific evalulation and risk assessment (Task 2.2).

result.title: Comfort and IAQ in heritage townhouses
result.description: The IEQ, HVAC concepts and energy use in existing heritage townhouses is investigated using data from existing literature and databases, and complementary measurements in selected case-study heritage town houses in three climate zones. The report will document the data and analyses, and the identified pre-renovation HVAC baseline scenarios (T3.1).

result.title: Optimisation of 5th Generation District Heating and Cooling Networks for different Flow Configurations

details.authors: Anna Dell'Isola , Louis Hermans, Lieve Helsen
details.journalTitle: Journal of Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment Systems
details.publisher: International Centre for Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment Systems (SDEWES Centre)

result.title: Communication and Dissemination plan (version 1)
result.description: Integrated Plan for and communication and dissemination that will determine actions and define responsibilities and timelines to communicate and disseminate widely the results of the work carried out (Task 7.1)

result.title: Website and social media
result.description: Launch of the project website, launch and first use of the social networks for community building (Task 7.3)

result.title: Data Management Plan (initial)
result.description: The DMP outlines how data will be collected/handled/stored according to the FAIR principles. It will outline the conditions for data preservation and publication, and clearly make a distinction between potentially sensitive or confidential information and open access data. The DMP also describes open access to research data.(Task 1.3)

result.title: Building envelope characteristics
result.description: The case-studies will adopt a uniform assessment procedure in line with EN 16883. For the different building envelope components the heritage characteristics (i), thermal performance (ii), and durability (iii) are evaluated. This report compiles the data and findings on the analysis of the building envelope characteristics for the different cases/regions (Task 2.1).

result.title: Mould Growth Risk for Internal Retrofit Insulation of Heritage-Protected Timber Plank Frame Walls

details.authors: Martha Eilertsen Harberg, Silje Kathrin Asphaug, Tore Kvande

result.title: HVAC-concepts for heritage buildings
result.description: This report contains a longlist and shortlist of conservation-compatible HVAC concepts for heritage townhouses. The longlist is based on a review of HVAC systems in the literature and market. The shortlist of measures is compiled from the longlist after a case-specific evalulation and is complemented with new and innovative solutions as starting point for the innovations in T3.3 and T3.4 (Task 3.2.1).

result.title: Cultural heritage analysis and value assessment
result.description: Compilation of cultural heritage values based on the cultural heritage analysis, covering aesthetic, architectural, historic, scientific, cultural, experiential, social values and beyond; (Task 5.1.1)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
